bibl.title: The Greek Adress System of the Roman Period and its Relationship to Latin
bibl.note: On the basis of nearly all the vocatives found in letters and petitions on papyrus. - I. Background and evidence. - II. Two address systems. - III. Relationship to Latin. - IV. General likelihood of external influence. - V. Individual words. - VI. Words attached to vocatives. - VII. The loss of the classical system. - VIII. Greek outside Egypt. - IX. The role of the classical address system. - X. Conclusions.
bibl.seg: DICKEY Eleanor, The Greek Address System of the Roman Period and its Relationship to Latin.

On the basis of nearly all the vocatives found in letters and petitions on papyrus. - I. Background and evidence. - II. Two address systems. - III. Relationship to Latin. - IV.
